actions.description: Cancels an order, with options for refunding, restocking inventory, and customer notification.Order cancellation is irreversible.
actions.name: cancelOrder

properties.description: The job that asynchronously cancels the order.
properties.name: job

properties.description: This indicates if the job is still queued or has been run.
properties.name: done

properties.description: A globally-unique ID that's returned when running an asynchronous mutation.
properties.name: id

properties.description: This field will only resolve once the job is done. Can be used to ask for object(s) that have been changed by the job.
properties.name: query

properties.description: The list of errors that occurred from executing the mutation.
The path to the input field that caused the error.
properties.name: field

properties.description: Whether to restock the inventory committed to the order.
properties.label: Restock

properties.description: Whether to refund to the original payment method.
properties.label: Original Payment Methods Refund
properties.name: originalPaymentMethodsRefund

properties.description: Whether to send a notification to the customer about the order cancellation.
properties.label: Notify Customer
properties.name: notifyCustomer

actions.title: Cancel Order

actions.description: Marks an open Order as closed. A closed order is one where merchants fulfill or cancel all LineItem objects and complete all financial transactions.

properties.description: The reason provided for an order cancellation.
properties.name: cancelReason

properties.description: The date and time in ISO 8601 format when an order was canceled.

properties.description: The IP address of the customer who placed the order.
properties.name: clientIp

properties.description: Whether inventory has been reserved for an order.
properties.name: confirmed

properties.description: The discount codes used for the order. Multiple codes can be applied to a single order.
